title: Keeping Our Rivers Green
description: To keep our rivers green, we will be dyeing them green! We will inject a small amount of dye in our Boneyard Creek to learn how pollutants travel in rivers. With this knowledge we can avoid the risks that pollution brings to our rivers. The exhibit will take place in shores of the Boneyard Creek around the area of the Bardeen Quadrangle. The dye is non toxic and approval will be requested to University of Illinois, Division of Safety and Compliance. Observation areas will be marked to avoid tripping hazards.
shortTitle: To keep our rivers green, we will be dyeing them green to learn how pollutants travel in rivers!

title: Physics Van
description: We do 3 hour long shows per EOH day in Loomis 141/151. It takes up nearly the entire room and we usually have a ton of attendance. Our demos range from liquid nitrogen demos, to electricity, and lasers. We also borrow departmental physics demos such as superconductivity rails, the bowling ball and a dart gun.
shortTitle: Come see Physics Van for their 30 year anniversary shows! We do cool things with liquid nitrogen, lasers, leaf blowers and more!!

title: Lab Tour of Sensing and Embedded Networked Systems (iSENS) Lab
description:
Visitors will be given the opportunity to try VR demos the lab has created and learn about radar and the kind of experiments that happen in the lab.
https://isens.cs.illinois.edu/
shortTitle: Visitors will be given the opportunity to try VR demos the lab has created and learn about radar and the kind of experiments that happen in the lab.

title: Professor Panel
description:
The professor panel is an opportunity for current and prospective students to ask professors about their fields, how to get involved with research, and pursuing academia/graduate school.                    
              
Friday Panelists:                 
Olga Mironenko - ECE,
Dr. Rebecca Reck - BioE and Systems,
Naira Hovakimyan - Control Robotics,
Julia Hockenmaier - Natural Language Processing and Siebel CS,
Danial Katz - NCSA Chief Scientist. 
  
Saturday Panelists:                            
Megan Matthews - Civil E,
John Abelson - MatSE,
Keilin Jahnke - ILEE,
Melkior Omik - Aerospace E,
Daniel Andruczyk - NPRE.
shortTitle: The professor panel is an opportunity for current and prospective students to ask professors about their fields, how to get involved with research, and pursuing academia/graduate school.

title: Horizon Blaze
description: Watch two rockets race between the bridges every hour! We designed and built 2 model rockets, and will race them between the bridges while teaching about the processes used to build rockets and the motors that power them.
shortTitle: Watch two rockets race between the bridges every hour! We designed and built 2 model rockets, and will race them between the bridges while teaching about the processes used to build rockets and the motors that power them.

title: Lab Tour of IoT (Internet of Things) lab
description: Tour of UIUC's IoT (Internet of Things) Research Lab
shortTitle: Tour of UIUC's IoT (Internet of Things) Research Lab

title: Robobrawl X
description: The Robobrawl competition consists of 30lb and 3D printed 1lb combat robots from different universities and hobbyist teams fighting one-on-one matches in a bracket with the goal of destroying the opponent's bot. We have been an exhibit at EOH for multiple years, and we are returning for our 10th anniversary, hence why we are Robobrawl X!
shortTitle: Robobrawl returns for its tenth anniversary! The Robobrawl competition consists of 30lb and 1lb combat robots from different universities and hobbyist teams fighting one-on-one matches. Let's rumble, robots!

title: Illini Service Dogs Outreach - Pet a Pup
description: We will educate people about what we do and our mission as an organization for our exhibit while letting people interact with our dogs during the event.
shortTitle: We will educate people about what we do and our mission as an organization for our exhibit while letting people interact with our dogs during the event.

title: Tesla Coil Concert
description: Just as dark falls, visit the Bardeen Quad to see an electrifying display of light and sound.
shortTitle: Just as dark falls, visit the Bardeen Quad to see an electrifying display of light and sound.

title: Keynote Speaker
description: Dr. Anna Oldani is passionate about creating opportunities for students to develop, technology to advance, and communities to grow. Come to her keynote speech to learn more about her journey through academia here at the University of Illinois and her career path!
shortTitle: Come to Anna Oldani's keynote speech to learn more about her journey through academia here at the University of Illinois and her career path!

title: Build-a-Blinkie
description:
Build-a-Blinkie is an organization dedicated to the teaching of STEM. We are teaching people to solder one
blinkie at a time. Come check out this interactive activity and take home your own soldered blinkie!
shortTitle: Build-a-Blinkie is an organization dedicated to the teaching of STEM. We are teaching people to solder one blinkie at a time. Come check out this interactive activity and take home your own soldered blinkie!

title: ESTAR Tour
description: Come learn more about the Grainger College of Engineering with a tour from ESTAR!
shortTitle: Come learn more about the Grainger College of Engineering with a tour from ESTAR!

title: Expanding the Nuclear Workforce
description:
Featuring experts in nuclear energy and workforce development, this event aims to engage and inspire
students, faculty, and visitors to explore opportunities in the nuclear industry, a critical field for clean energy
advancement. Come listen to a discussion between our amazing panelists and pose your own questions!
shortTitle: Come to learn more about opportunities in the nuclear industry!

title: Car Teams Demo
description:
This EOH showcase track is for vehicles built and designed by engineering student teams for collegiate
competitions. This is a great opportunity for action pictures and for the public to talk to team members
shortTitle: This EOH showcase track is for vehicles built and designed by engineering student teams for collegiate competitions. This is a great opportunity for action pictures and for the public to talk to team members.

title: Chai Town
description: Come listen to UIUC’s famous South Asian acapella group!
shortTitle: Come listen to UIUC’s famous South Asian acapella group!

title: Interactive Lego Design
description:
The Lego Design Lab is a place designed for students of all ages to engage in interactive lego building and
coding. There will be 3 stations: Robot Maze, Machine Building, and Spider Obstacles.
shortTitle: Interactive Lego building and coding for all ages!

title: Murder Mystery with Tau Beta Pi
description: The project is a murder mystery that the children will solve. During the exhibit, we have incorporated many principles of engineering, such as bioengineering, material engineering, and environmental engineering, to teach the children about various types of engineering and how that is important for solving real-world problems, such as a crime scene. There will be multiple stations that the children will walk through as they solve this crime and gather more information. Some parts will be interactive such as testing fingerprinting equipment or asking questions to the "suspect". Children will carry a clip board and write down information.
shortTitle: Be a detective and help us find the murderer! Discover how engineering skills can help solve this mystery.

title: Startup Showcase
description: The Startup Showcase is dedicated to celebrating student entrepreneurs! Come see what our inventive Illinois students have been working on at their booths (available in TEC Office, CIF 1038, 9 am-4 pm excluding keynote speaker and pitch competition) and experience demos, giveaways, and much more!
shortTitle: Keynote Speaker and Pitch Competition celebrating UIUC's student entrepreneurs!

title: Face Painting
description: Face Painting!
shortTitle: Face Painting!

title: Alumni Coffee Chats
description:
Students can get to know alumni in a more personal setting! This is a great opportunity to ask alums about
their time at the U of I, the industries they work in, and how students can plan their lives after college.
shortTitle: Students can get to know alumni in a more personal setting!

title: Mom’s Weekend Design Comp
description: Stop by with your mom or friends and compete in our design competition! Spend as long as you would like and show off your engineering intuition
shortTitle: Stop by with your mom or friends and compete in our design competition! Spend as long as you would like and show off your engineering intuition

title: Alumni Panel
shortTitle: Come visit our Alumni Panel, featuring notable UIUC alumni to ask qeustions and learn more about the amazing accomplishments of Grainger Engineers!

title: NovoPrint: Robotic 3D Printing Arm
description: Our group intends to build a multi-extruder robotic arm that will be utilized for a high-precision additive manufacturing or 3D printing technique, Fused Filament Fabrication (FFF).   The robotic arm will be fixed and supported at the bottom on a base plate, and will have roughly six linkages to enable six degrees of freedom for accurate printing. At the end of the arm, there will be an extruder head that will use molten plastic (either filament or pellets) to print the desired CAD design onto the build plate. Credible motion planning algorithms will be used such that the arm has a constrained sphere of influence and does not harm the spectators in any way. The goal is to have spectators and participants select a CAD design and have the robotic arm print that design every 30 minutes during the exhibit times throughout the day.
shortTitle: An exhilarating, futuristic spectacle that combines robotics and 3D printing to produce real-life CAD models!

title: Workshops in Python, CAD, & Web Dev
description: Join us for a workshops in Python, CAD, and Web Design at the Engineering Hall computer lab.
shortTitle: Join us for a workshops in Python, CAD, and Web Design at the Engineering Hall computer lab.

title: Grainger Welcome Resource Fair
description:
Congratulations admitted new first-year and transfer engineering students! Start your Engineering Open
House visit at the Campus Instructional Facility (CIF) Monumental Steps to receive a limited-edition gift while supplies last. Then join us for a Student Panel to meet a Dean and connect with current students. Stop by the College Resource Fair to learn about future opportunities and take a fun, commemorative photo!
shortTitle: Stop by the College Resource Fair to learn about future opportunities and take a fun, commemorative photo!

title: LabEscape: Reservation Only
description:
LabEscape is RESERVATION ONLY. Please book for one of the available slots at: labescape.org/EOH2025 

Participants will undertake a quantum "mission" in this science-based escape room, running in room 1262 DCL.
shortTitle: A terrible tragedy threatens the entire world - quantum tech is our only hope.  Are YOU up to the challenge of the world's only science-based escape room???
